Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.custom_middleware(request: Request, call_next)¶

The custom_middleware function is a middleware function that adds the time it took to process the request to the response headers. This can be used for performance monitoring.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the request object

  • call_next – Call the next middleware in the chain

Returns:

A response object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.favicon()¶

The favicon function returns the favicon.ico file from the static directory.

Returns:

A file response with the contents of the favicon

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is used to check the health of the database. It will return a 200 status code if it can successfully connect to the database, and a 500 status code otherwise.

Parameters:

db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.limit_access_by_ip(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The limit_access_by_ip function is a middleware function that limits access to the API by IP address. It checks if the client’s IP address is in ALLOWED_IPS, and if not, returns a 403 Forbidden response.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the ip address of the client that is making a request

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the next function in the chain to be executed

Returns:

A jsonresponse object if the client ip address is not in allowed_ips

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.root(request: Request)¶

The root function is the entry point for the web application. It returns a TemplateResponse object, which renders an HTML template using Jinja2. The template is located in templates/index.html and uses data from the request object to render itself.

Parameters:

request – Request: Get the request object

Returns:

A templateresponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are used by the app, such as databases or caches.

Returns:

A list of objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Validate the data sent by the user

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthday_list(quontity_days: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact] | None¶

The get_birthday_list function returns a list of contacts whose birthday will be in the near future &quot;count_days&quot;

Parameters:

  • quontity_days – int: Specify the number of days to search for birthdays

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday will be in the near future &quot;count_days&quot;

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_id(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶
The get_contact_id function searches for a contact by its id.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to search for. user (User): The user who owns the contacts being searched through. db (Session): A database session object used to query the database with SQLAlchemy’s ORM methods.

Returns:

Contact: A single Contact object that matches the given criteria.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Search for a contact by id

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Create a connection to the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_search(dict_values: dict, user: User, limit: int, offset: int, db: Session) → List[Contact] | None¶
The get_contacts_search function searches for contacts in the database.
Args:

dict_values (dict): A dictionary of search parameters. user (User): The user who is searching for contacts. limit (int): The maximum number of results to return from the query. offset (int): The starting point from which to begin returning results, used for pagination purposes.

Returns: List[Contact]

Parameters:

  • dict_values – dict: Pass in the search parameters

  • user – User: Get the user’s contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first offset contacts in the list

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. user (User): The user who is removing the contact. db (Session): A connection to our database session, used for querying and deleting contacts.

Returns:

Contact | None: If successful, returns a Contact object representing the deleted record; otherwise returns None.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object or none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdate: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the database

  • db – Session: Get access to the database

Returns:

A contact object or none

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function sets the confirmed field of a user to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object containing the information to be added to the database. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy Session object used for querying and updating data in the database.

Returns:

User: A User object representing a newly created user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass the user data to the function

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶
The get_user_by_email function returns a user object from the database based on the email address provided.
Args:

email (str): The email address of the user to be retrieved. db (Session): A connection to a database session.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Args:

email (str): The email address of the user to update. url (str): The URL for the new avatar image. db (Session, optional): A database session object to use instead of creating one locally. Defaults to None. # noQA: E501 line too long, but this is an example! # noQA: E501 line too long, but this is an example! # noQA: E501 line too long, but this is an example! # noQ

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of the parameter

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user

  • token – str | None: Determine whether the user is logged in or not

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

The function takes a ContactModel object as input and returns the newly created contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Create a new contact

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository function

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthday_list(quontity_days: int = Path(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_birthday_list function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next X days.

Parameters:

  • quontity_days – int: Get the number of days to search for birthdays

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of contacts with their birthdays in the next 30 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_id(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contact_id function returns a contact by id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object from the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_search(name: str | None = None, surname: str | None = None, email: str | None = None, phone: str | None = None, limit: int = Query(5), offset: int = 0, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_contacts_search function is used to search for contacts in the database.

The function takes a name, surname, email and phone number as parameters. If any of these are not provided then they will be ignored when searching for contacts.

Parameters:

  • name – str: Search for a contact by name

  • surname – str: Search for contacts with the surname specified in the parameter

  • email – str: Search for a contact by email

  • phone – str: Search for a contact by phone number

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Get the next set of contacts

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A list of contacts, which is a list of dictionaries

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. current_user (User): The user who is making this request. db (Session): A connection to the database for querying and updating data.

Returns:

Contact: A dictionary containing information about the deleted contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id of the contact to be removed

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes a ContactUpdate object as input, which contains the fields to be updated. It also takes an integer representing the id of the contact to be updated and returns that same contact with its new values.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdate: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • contact_id – int: Get the id of the contact to be updated

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the token

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A contactupdate object, which is a pydantic model

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function returns the current user’s information.

— get: tags: [users] # This is a tag that can be used to group operations by resources or any other qualifier. summary: Returns the current user’s information. description: Returns the current user’s information based on their JWT token in their request header. responses: # The possible responses this operation can return, along with descriptions and examples of each response type (if applicable). &quot;200&quot;: # HTTP status code 200 indicates success! In this case, it means we successfully returned a User

Parameters:

current_user – User: Pass the user object to the function

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.
Args:

file (UploadFile): The image to be uploaded. current_user (User): The user whose avatar is being updated. db (Session): A database session for interacting with the database.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object, but i want to return the src_url

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, an error message is returned. If they do exist but their email has already been confirmed, another error message is returned. Otherwise (if everything goes well), we update their record in our database so that their &quot;confirmed&quot; field becomes True.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token, refresh token and a bearer type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token, refresh_token, and token type.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the credentials from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. It then checks if there is already a user with that email in the database, and if so it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message to the user, but it doesn’t return a response object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It also sends an email to the user’s email address for confirmation. The function returns a JSON object containing the newly created user and a message.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user information from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the user and a detail message

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
client_redis = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A string that is the encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶
The create_email_token function creates a token that is used to verify the user’s email address.
The token contains the following data:

  • iat (issued at): The time when the token was created.

  • exp (expiration): When this token expires, 7 days from now.

  • scope: What this JWT can be used for, in this case it is an email_token which means it can only be used to verify an email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into a token

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded with the user’s id, email and username

Doc-author:

Trelent

credentials_exception = HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Could not validate credentials')¶
async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function takes a refresh token and decodes it.

If the scope is ‘refresh_token’, then we return the email address of the user. Otherwise, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message ‘Invalid scope for token’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who requested a refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be called by FastAPI to get the current user. It uses the token in the Authorization header, decodes it and returns an object with all of its claims.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the header of the request

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object with the following fields:

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. If the scope of the token is not ‘email_token’, then it raises an HTTPException. If there is a JWTError, then it also raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email associated with the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password.

The function uses the pwd_context object to generate a hash from the given password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass the password to be hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
async set_current_user(user: User)¶
The set_current_user function is used to set the current user in redis.
Args:

user (User): The User object that will be stored in redis.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • user – User: Store the user object in redis

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

verify_jwt_token(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer))¶

The verify_jwt_token function is a dependency for the protected endpoints. It will be called in the background to check if the user has access rights. If there is no valid token, it will raise an HTTPException with the error text.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

Returns:

The email of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶
The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password,

and returns True if they match, False otherwise. This is used to verify that the user’s login credentials are correct.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method belong to the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password in the database with a plain text password

Returns:

A boolean value, true or false

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three arguments:

-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for them. -username: the username of the user who is registering. This will be displayed in their confirmation message so they know it was sent to them and not someone else. -host: this is where we are hosting our application, which will be used as part of our confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Check if the email is valid

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the host name of your application

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Cloud images¶

class src.services.cloud_images.CloudImage¶

Bases: object

static generate_name_avatar(email: str)¶
The generate_name_avatar function takes an email address as input and returns a unique name for the avatar image.

The function uses the SHA256 hash algorithm to generate a unique string from the email address, then truncates it to 12 characters. This is used as part of the file path where we will store our avatar images.

Parameters:

email – str: Specify the type of parameter that is expected to be passed into the function

Returns:

A string that is the path to the image

Doc-author:

Trelent

static get_url_for_avatar(public_id, r)¶

The get_url_for_avatar function takes a public_id and an optional resource dictionary. It returns the URL for the avatar image, which is a 250x250px crop of the original image.

Parameters:

  • public_id – Identify the image in cloudinary

  • r – Get the version of the image

Returns:

The url of the image

Doc-author:

Trelent

static upload(file, public_id: str)¶
The upload function takes a file and public_id as arguments.

The function then uploads the file to Cloudinary with the given public_id, overwriting any existing files with that id. It returns a dictionary containing information about the uploaded image.

Parameters:

  • file – Upload a file to the cloudinary server

  • public_id – str: Specify the public id of the image

Returns:

A dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent
